item.title: Carey add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Carey add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Carey add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Carey add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Love, the poet said, is woman's whole existence." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Carey add a quote by Heraclitus
Carey add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "You are an aperture through which the universe is looking at and exploring itself." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Carey add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Carey add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Carey add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "The creative adult is the child who has survived." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Carey add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Nobody who says, ‘I told you so’ has ever been, or will ever be, a hero." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Carey add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "What sane person could live in this world and not be crazy?" -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Carey add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I read for pleasure and that is the moment I learn the most." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Carey add a quote by Alan Wilson Watts
item.description: "The art of living... is neither careless drifting on the one hand nor fearful clinging to the past on the other. It consists in being sensitive to each moment, in regarding it as utterly new and unique, in having the mind open and wholly receptive." -- Alan Wilson Watts

item.title: Carey add a quote by Alan Wilson Watts
item.description: "The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple. And yet, everybody rushes around in a great panic as if it were necessary to achieve something beyond themselves." -- Alan Wilson Watts
